info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 11:46PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Pickens County through 1215 AM EDT... At 1146 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Pickens, or near Keowee Toxaway State Park, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pickens, Six Mile, Keowee Toxaway State Park, Table Rock State Park, Jocassee Gorges, Lake Keowee, Sunset, Pumpkintown, Dacusville and Nine Times. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
